GeneralInformation.School Vision: A Vibrant School, A Learning Community Committed to Excellence
GeneralInformation.School Mission: Maximising the Potential of all Learners
GeneralInformation.School Philosophy, Culture and Ethos: Rising from a long and rich history in education, Guangyang Primary School today strives to embody excellence in holistic development of pupils.  The school employs a key philosophy of "culture of care" in its work to build up its staff to nurture and develop its students to their maximum potential. This guiding philosophy shapes school policies and work culture, and is spearheaded by school leaders, propagated by middle managers and is exemplified by all staff in the nurturing of pupils.   In Guangyang Primary School, pupils from diverse backgrounds enjoy a variety of developmental experiences by a dedicated and capable team of staff. With a "mindset of excellence" and "all hands-on-deck" attitude, the school excels in its efforts to foster an all-inclusive vibrant environment for its pupils.   Working in close collaboration with our stakeholders and community partners, the school offers a values-driven, holistic education that develops students as excellent learners, strong in character and citizenship. The school's five core values namely Loyalty, Courage, Honesty, Diligence and Teamwork are infused into all parts of everyday school life. These values guide the school towards reaching its vision and mission.
GeneralInformation.Type of School: GOVERNMENT SCHOOL / CO-ED SCHOOL / SINGLE SESSION

School Distinctive Programmes.Music & Performing Arts: LIVE YOUR PASSION â€“ developing life-long learners with a passion for Music, Dance and Drama

SpecialProgrammes.Special Student Development Programmes O: The school believes in the holistic development of pupils in multiple domains.  In the area of aesthetics, the A# Talent Development Programme is a progressive programme that aims to nurture talents in performing arts. Pupil receive advance developmental instruction in both theoretical and practical aspects in music and handbell performance in order to stretch their abilities and maximise their potential. Pupils are given opportunities to showcase their talents through school based and outreach programmes. Pupils  are exposed to physical activities through PE and CCAs to build up their physical capabilities. Values-in-action (VIA) programmes such as the Hand-in-Hand Project provide opportunities for pupil to develop in the social and moral domain.  In the cognitive domain, the school employs a range of intervention strategies to cater to the different abilities of pupils. Integrated Project Work (IPW) is also implemented from Primary 1 to Primary 5 pupils with the aim to integrate learning across subjects such as ICT, Arts and Character and Citizenship and nurture pupils as engaged learners in the long term. Pupils are given the opportunities to develop leadership and teamwork skills. The school also provides opportunities for pupils to be exposed to a variety of experiences beyond the school through overseas and local learning journeys. The Overseas Learning Journey (OLJ) serves to provide pupils with diverse experiences in pursuit of developing well-informed global citizens of society. It enriches the pupils knowledge of history of a South East Asia country,  expose them to a variety of experiences and build independence.  Science Discovery Day (SDD) is an experiential science learning programme conducted for all levels (P3-P6). SDD extends beyond the Science curriculum, and infuses learning of other areas such as National Education and ICT. It is a platform for pupils to take learning beyond the classroom.
